A man told me I was “too muscular for a female.” He said I had “thunder thighs” as well 🙄 ... so, I took a selfie to remind myself that MUSCLES ARE RAD! ⠀
If anyone tries to make you feel bad by calling you “too muscular” (or actually any insult) you should #flex in the mirror and say “THANK YOU!” I’m pretty sure this guy goes home alone every night. Men like him will never be happy because criticizing a woman for having “too many muscles” is really as lame as it gets.💪🏻 #flexdemguns #musclesarerad #strongwomenarerad
⠀

Shout out to all the working Moms out there. I see you ... I’m right there with you. You are doing a GREAT job!
⠀
This is me ... I haven’t showered today nor washed my hair in 10. I also haven’t gone to the grocery store in weeks and #confession, I’ve been living off frozen French fries and a bag of dried cranberries all week.
⠀
My laundry is piled up (clean but not put away... I’m not sure it ever gets put away. We kind of live off the top of the basket 😂! Am I the only one?) and my dishwasher just broke, so I’ve been avoiding that part of the house hoping somehow the dishes will clean themselves.
⠀
My kids however, are clean, fed, and homework is done, so I consider that #winning at the Mom thing today. Do you agree?🙋🏼‍♀️👩‍👦‍👦
⠀
I may be tired and feeling overwhelmed, but I wouldn’t change a thing. I love my family and I also love working. Maybe if I didn’t work the house would be cleaner and everything would be 👌🏼, but then I’d have no need for this post😉. ⠀
PS: Tomorrow I’m filming for my Playbook App! If you subscribe, send me a message here or in the app and tell me what you’d like to see! Annnnnd.... New YogaMedBall program coming out soon!
⠀
#momlife #workingmom

You wouldn’t believe how many students can enter a #straighthandstand (and hold it) if they just act like they don’t care. This is always an “ah ha” moment for the class. ⠀

💥The body is truly amazing. At 44, I can’t believe I can do this stuff.💥I was never a gymnast or dancer or even tried to handstand until the age of 37. With doctor diagnosis’ of #fibromyalgia, #carpaltunnel, and #herniateddiscs, I pretty much thought I’d NEVER do things like this.
⠀
Depression gripped me, and I’d all but given up until one day I thought “what if I just tried?”
⠀
Here I am a new creation. Never give up on yourself or your dream of a better life (physical, mental or emotional). We can do amazing things that we don’t even know are possible.
⠀
So, when do you want to start believing in the IMpossible?
⠀
If I can change, anyone can.🙏🏻
⠀
PS: I’ve been obsessed with the #PuppyPress 🐶 handstand lately. Should I do a tutorial on it?
⠀ 👉🏻beachyogagirlapp.com
Full Yoga, Core & Handstand Programs on my Playbook App!👈🏻
Link in bio. ⠀ #youcan #changeispossible #yogi #handstandpractice #puppypresshandstand #questforthepress #handstandclinic

HOW TO work your #psoas muscle, your brain, and brush your teeth at the same time.😆 Try using your left hand (if you are right handed) and you’ll really work your 🧠 !
⠀
Did you go try this yet? Can you do it?
⠀
You’re welcome.😁

One of the things that I want to start doing with my account is to share with you people that bring me joy.
⠀
@erintron is someone that just makes me happy. She is such a bright light. She is not only gorgeous, smart, & talented, but so funny - in that absolute hilarious dry humor kind of way. If you don’t find her funny, something might be wrong with you.😁
⠀
She’s shy yet open and shares her awkward moments which makes her so lovable. She is an artist and feels everything on a deep level which I not only relate to, but it makes her someone I love to follow. Somehow I know if we lived close to each other, we’d be the best of friends.
⠀
Instagram can be sometimes full of people trying to get “likes” by showing more than they should or doing things just “for the gram” but Erin is just Erin and I love that.
⠀
If you are looking for inspiring content that makes you feel something, check her out. @erintron ⠀
#repost @erintron 🎶 Song: Walls | @kingsofleon

Do you agree?
💕

“Marriage is hard work” I have always heard, and I agreed with the first 10 years of my marriage. In fact, most of my life, I felt marriage was nothing but a system of control and would only eventually hurt you. I was lucky enough however, to marry an alcoholic who found recovery. Yes, lucky... extremely blessed beyond belief.
⠀
I talk about this from time to time, but around the holidays, I know it can be really hard for some who may not have come to terms yet with their or someone else’s disease of addiction.
⠀
I have addiction in my family (who doesn’t, right?) and yes, I also married someone who suffered from this progressive, horrible disease. It steals people’s lives away - in plain sight - and everyone blames the victim. “Why can’t you just stop?!” That’s what I use to think until I also got help for my part in the disease. It took some deep inner healing and education to understand this monster of a disease. To this day, finding recovery was the best thing I’ve ever done or will do for the rest of my life. I’m so grateful to God, and for those who helped me along the way. I am also so grateful for my husband, who just celebrated 10 years of sobriety! 🎉 He is my best friend, my boo, my carpenter, my fixer of all things, my provider, and the best father I could have asked for to my 2 sons.
⠀
I don’t know what I’m doing in this photo😂, but my husband looks hot 🔥😍, so I’d like to honor him today.😉 He is my walking miracle and proof that “it works if you work it!”
⠀
I love you, baby! Thank you for showing me that marriage can be EASY when you just focus on doing the next right thing.
😘
⠀
@inlovewithbeachyogagirl
#grateful #inlove #143 #marriageisntwork #iglove #12steps
⠀

I’m reading through the comment section of my acne post from yesterday and 95% of it was “thank you for sharing” or people saying “I’m brave” which, kinda make me feel weird. I get it, I’m brave because society tells us we need to hide that stuff, but it’s not very brave in my opinion. It’s just honest and maybe that’s why people call it brave. Let’s all be brave, ok?
⠀
There was a bit of an argument over whether or not #veganism is healthy and “ruining the planet”. Also, some comments on how vegans are judgmental - to which I can honestly say that I felt that way before I was a vegan🙋🏼‍♀️.
⠀
I couldn’t stand vegans. I felt they were always judging me and I thought they were so preachy. But, after I became one, I saw their heart. I saw their compassion to end animal suffering. I saw how much they just wanted to save innocent animals from living a life of agony. I felt how much love they had in their heart & I understood why I felt judged. It wasn’t personal it was just passion.
⠀
I am not here to tell anyone to do anything or live any certain way. I’m just sharing what works for me.🙏🏻 I don’t judge you for not being vegan or anything else that I believe in that you don’t. We can still be friends, I promise. I think some (not all) #vegans need to remember that the same compassion they have for animals will work on humans ... or at least let non-vegans know that some of us vegans are really cool people.😎 🌱 ⠀
#Vegan #plantbased #letsgetalong

👀 Hello hip flexibility and pelvis stability💪🏻! This was a really interesting drill to see the subtle differences in strength vs flexibility on each side of my body.

Using a #resistanceband changes the stretch to make it more active and the muscles respond SO much better when you give them #strength combined with #stretch! It’s also a really good drill for anyone who is working on the vertical line in #handstand. I stole this idea from @tditty2 💕

Want to know how to activate the deep TVA & pelvic floor when jumping with two feet into #handstand like this? 🙋🏼‍♀️
⠀
1. Grab a block ◻️
2. Put in between your legs🦵
3. Squeeze 😖
4. Jump 😱 (with both feet😉)

I’ve been waiting so long to share about my skin & I finally feel ready. I have struggled with acne ALL my life & after I turned 40 it got pretty bad. I’ve done harsh drugs like Acutane & tried every acne medicine know to man to no avail.
⠀
I will share what I’ve done - not saying this will help anyone but simply what has helped me.
⠀
A little over 2 years ago, I decided to go Vegan. I got rid of all dairy and meat products and found that had a huge effect on my skin. Unfortunately, I was eating a lot of processed foods (not really knowing how to do the vegan thing) and noticed that if I had too much soy or corn, I’d break out. I began drinking water about 6 months ago like crazy - which really helped but I was still having minor breakouts. Then about 2 months ago I rediscovered @medicalmedium & celery juice. I began drinking it every single morning on an empty stomach. This had the biggest effect on my skin. I immediately noticed within 2 days how fast my acne cleared up. Since then, I’ve been figuring out what is going on in my gut. What foods create inflammation & what foods feed the Epstein-Barr virus that I believe is the cause of my #Fibromyalgia. I have tried to stay away from all processed food & only eat real food - plants grown in the ground. Nothing from a package. Yes, this is very hard to do and no, I’m not perfect at it. I struggle when I’m starving, but it’s doable when you have lots of fruit in the house.
⠀
I also began eating 2 apples a day and 2 (if I can) bananas a day. I eat high alkaline fruits ALL DAY LONG. I feel like this was the key (along with all the rest) to really helping my skin and my fibromyalgia.
⠀
I’m not a nutritionist, but I know that all the toxins/viruses in my body feed off acidic foods.
Basically (if I understand properly) I’m starving them by eating foods that are the opposite and the #fruit helps my liver to flush them out.
⠀
I have been doing a slow colon #detox from @alkalineveganshop which has also really helped. I’ve paid for all these products & this is not a sponsored post. I just want to share because I know how it feels to hate your skin. ⠀
Much love!💕
#nofilter #nomakeup

Pressing & Floating #handstandclinic Tutorial! 🙃 I had someone in my private Facebook group (for my @handstandtrainer Ebook) ask about pressing into #handstand. She asked if her hamstrings were too tight or her hip flexors too weak. I asked her to try this wall pike and float down.
⠀
This drill lets you know if it is your #flexibility or your strength.💪🏻🔥
⠀
If you feel this in the #hamstrings, then it’s a good indication that they might be too tight to hold the position. If you feel it in the #hipflexors/#core, then strength is needed. If you feel heavy and can’t find the #float then working on just holding the position and pushing hips back will help strengthen the muscles needed. Spend a good 30 seconds to 1 minute here to build up the strength!
⠀
Remember to engage that #TVA (see my last post) and press the ground away! Look between your hands and notice how far back the hips have to be - this is the same position needed to eventually press up!
⠀
I have a handstand program on my playbook! For Android users, download my #handstandtrainer Ebook! Link 🔗 in profile.

I’m starting a new post series called #handstandclinic. Once a week I will share my best tips and practices for training and learning handstands.🤸‍♀️
⠀ 👉🏻 Follow this tag #handstandclinic 👈🏻and leave me questions on these posts of what you are struggling with. I’ll do my best to help you🙌🏻!
⠀
For today’s #HandstandClinic drill we are working on #forearm and #core strength with L #handstand wrist taps. In order to gain control over your handstand, you need both forearm and core strength. This drill addresses both! This intermediate drill will be especially hard for anyone with tight shoulders or limited core strength, but I promise if you work on it, you will become solid and strong in your handstands! Want to try? Tag me in your posts if you do!
⠀
TAG a friend👯‍♀️, bookmark the post, and don’t forget to leave me questions in the comments! I’ll pick what to address next from the comments below!
⠀
#learntohandstand
⠀
www.beachyogagirl app.com

The deep abdominals or the transverse abdominis (TVA) is a hard muscle to target. A lot of times people focus on the more superficial muscles of the obliques or the rectus abdominis when “activating” their core, but the key to stability, whether it be in a handstand or just daily life, is the TVA.
⠀
If you don’t intentionally focus on engaging it, the surrounding muscles can take over, and although you are “strong”, you end up with back pain or you can’t do things like press handstand even though you feel “strong” enough to do it.
⠀
This is a very simple exercise laying on your back. Relax your breath and keep your pelvis in neutral. Then, lift and squeeze the pelvic floor (like a kegel exercise) as you draw the navel into the spine. The key is not to move your hips and to think of a girdle pulling you in.
⠀
I gave a demo on my live today if you want more info! I also have core training and yoga classes on my Playbook App! Link in my profile.🔗
⠀
Tag someone who needs to know this!
⠀
#healthyback #spinehealth #tva #transverseabdominis #deepabs #coreworkout
